Title: Very Easy Origami
Subtitle: Here we start with some very easy origami for kids, and build our way up to some slightly harder models for older kids, or children that need an extra challenge...
Description: Here we start with some very easy origami for kids, and build our way up to some slightly harder models for older kids, or children that need an extra challenge...

Items.Title: Talking Dog
Items.Subtitle:
The origami talking dog is really easy, and kids love it!
You'll need a marker to draw on the eyes, nose and tongue, so have fun!
Items.Description:
The origami talking dog is really easy, and kids love it!
You'll need a marker to draw on the eyes, nose and tongue, so have fun!

Steps.Tutorial:
The origami talking dog is really easy, and kids love it!
You'll need a marker to draw on the eyes, nose and tongue, so have fun!
Start with your paper white side up.Fold in half then open.
Fold the top corner down to the bottom corner.
Fold the two top corners down to the points shown.
Fold the uppermost layer of the bottom corner up a little way.
Fold this layer up again, from the top of the triangle as shown.
Add eyes and a nose to the dog’s face. If you like you can even add a tongue!
Finished Talking Dog! To make your dog talk, hold the model by the ears and move back and forwards shown by the arrows.

Items.Title: Lady Bug
Items.Subtitle: Make the origami ladybug out of red or yellow paper, and then draw some pretty spots on it afterwards.
Items.Description: Make the origami ladybug out of red or yellow paper, and then draw some pretty spots on it afterwards.

Steps.Tutorial: Make the origami ladybug out of red or yellow paper, and then draw some pretty spots on it afterwards.
Start with a square piece of paper, white side up. Fold in half.
Fold this triangle in half, crease well then open.
Fold the top 2 corners downwards, but not right to the centre line: leave a little gap.
Turn model over. Fold down top corner to the centre point of the model.
Now fold this corner upwards, and flatten.
Turn back over. Finished Ladybug.
LADY BUG

Items.Title: Lucky Start
Items.Subtitle:
The origami lucky star is so easy to make, but it looks so pretty... soon you'll be making hundreds!
You make it with a strip of paper. A good starting size is about 30cm, or 1 foot long, and about 1cm wide, or about half an inch.
Once you have made a couple, you can choose the length and width that you think makes the best star.
Items.Description:
The origami lucky star is so easy to make, but it looks so pretty... soon you'll be making hundreds!
You make it with a strip of paper. A good starting size is about 30cm, or 1 foot long, and about 1cm wide, or about half an inch.
Once you have made a couple, you can choose the length and width that you think makes the best star.

Steps.Tutorial:
The origami lucky star is so easy to make, but it looks so pretty... soon you'll be making hundreds!
You make it with a strip of paper. A good starting size is about 30cm, or 1 foot long, and about 1cm wide, or about half an inch.
Once you have made a couple, you can choose the length and width that you think makes the best star.
Start with a strip of paper. Tie a knot in the end of your paper.
Pull gently to tighten, then flatten.

Fold the end of the strip down and tuck it into the knot.
You can cut a bit of it off if it's too long.
Now wrap the other end of the strip around and around this pentagon you have formed, creasing gently as you go.

Keep wrapping until you get to the end of the strip.
Tuck the last bit of the strip into the pouch. You should be left with a cute little pentagon.
Now to make this little pentagon into a star, very gently and slowly use your fingernail to press on the centre of each of its edges. The star should puff out.

And you should have a lovely little lucky star!
It may take some practise to get the star to puff out perfectly, but stick with it... you’ll get it!

Items.Title: Simple Hat
Items.Subtitle:
The Origami Hat is a great model for kids to make, because it's so simple and fun to wear afterwards!
Use a large piece of paper, or newspaper for this design.
Items.Description:
The Origami Hat is a great model for kids to make, because it's so simple and fun to wear afterwards!
Use a large piece of paper, or newspaper for this design.

Steps.Tutorial:
The Origami Hat is a great model for kids to make, because it's so simple and fun to wear afterwards!
Use a large piece of paper, or newspaper for this design.
Start with a rectangular piece of paper, white side up. Fold the paper in half and open.
Now fold the top down to the bottom edge. Crease well.
Fold the top corners down to the centre line.
Fold the bottom edge (uppermost layer only) up to the base of the triangles.
Fold this part up once again, and crease well.
Turn model over, and repeat step 4 & 5 on the other side.
Open out the hat to shape it,Your hat is now finished!

Items.Title: Pelican
Items.Subtitle: This beautiful origami pelican is simple and elegant, and it will stand up by itself. Use a small sheet of square paper to create this pretty design.
Items.Description: This beautiful origami pelican is simple and elegant, and it will stand up by itself. Use a small sheet of square paper to create this pretty design.

Steps.Tutorial: This beautiful origami pelican is simple and elegant, and it will stand up by itself. Use a small sheet of square paper to create this pretty design.
Start with your paper white side up. Fold in half, along the line shown, then open out again.
Fold the outside corners into the centre line, and crease well.
Fold the outside edges into the centre once again.
Turn model over and fold bottom point up to the top point. Crease very well.
Fold in half.
Rotate model so it is now lying down.
Raise the inside triangle upwards slowly, then flatten and crease well.
Inside Reverse Fold the head along the crease shown.
Fold each wing upward as shown, then fold it back again slightly. The pelican will now rest on its wings and sit up.
Finished Pelican!

Items.Title: Jumping Frog
Items.Subtitle: The Origami Jumping Frog is really easy to make... To make the frog jump to its best potential, use paper that's a bit thicker. You will need to use rectangular paper for this model.
Items.Description: The Origami Jumping Frog is really easy to make... To make the frog jump to its best potential, use paper that's a bit thicker. You will need to use rectangular paper for this model.

Steps.Tutorial: The Origami Jumping Frog is really easy to make... To make the frog jump to its best potential, use paper that's a bit thicker. You will need to use rectangular paper for this model.
Start with a rectangular sheet of paper, white side up. Fold it in half, and open out again
Fold both top corners to the opposite edge of the paper then unfold. Your creases should look like this.
Where the diagonal creases meet in the middle, fold the paper backwards, crease well and open.
Hold the paper at the sides, bring these points down to the centre line, then flatten. The creases should do most of the work here!
Fold the uppermost triangles up to the top point.
Fold sides in to the centre line.
Fold bottom of model upwards so the end sits in the centre of the top diamond.
Now fold the same part downwards, in half.
Turn over, your Jumping Frog is finished! To make him jump, press down on his back as shown.

Items.Title: Drinking Cup
Items.Subtitle: The origami drinking cup is a traditional and popular design, and if you make it out of grease proof paper, you can actually use it as a real cup!
Items.Description: Make the origami ladybug out of red or yellow paper, and then draw some pretty spots on it afterwards.

Steps.Tutorial: The origami drinking cup is a traditional and popular design, and if you make it out of grease proof paper, you can actually use it as a real cup!
Start with your paper white side up. Fold in half, as shown.
Fold the top corner down to the baseline. Crease well and unfold.
Fold the bottom left hand corner up to the crease line just made.
Now fold the bottom right hand corner up to the opposite side.
Fold the front flap downwards.
Now fold the back top flap backwards inthe same manner.
Open out. Your drinking cup is finished!

Items.Title: Sail Boats
Items.Subtitle: In this diagram, you can make two origami sail boats out of one piece of paper.
Items.Description: Make the origami ladybug out of red or yellow paper, and then draw some pretty spots on it afterwards.

Steps.Tutorial: In this diagram, you can make two origami sail boats out of one piece of paper.
Start with a square piece of paper, white side up. Fold the paper in half, then open.Cut the paper in half along this crease.
With one of the triangles, fold in half, and open.
Fold the top corner downwards to meet the bottom edge of the triangle.
Fold the two bottom corners upwards to meet together in the middle.
Fold the bottom corner up to the centre of the model. Then turn the model over.

Finished Sail boat.
Now you can make another one with the other triangle, and you will have two sail boats!

Title: Origami Animal
Subtitle: Here we start with some very easy origami for kids, and build our way up to some slightly harder models for older kids, or children that need an extra challenge...
Description: Here we start with some very easy origami for kids, and build our way up to some slightly harder models for older kids, or children that need an extra challenge...

Items.Title: Horse
Items.Subtitle: The fantastic origami horse is a favourite amongst anyone who has made it! It's a simple model to make, and once you have finished... just a sharp tap on the tail and the horse will flip for you!
Items.Description: The fantastic origami horse is a favourite amongst anyone who has made it! It's a simple model to make, and once you have finished... just a sharp tap on the tail and the horse will flip for you!

Steps.Tutorial: The fantastic origami horse is a favourite amongst anyone who has made it! It's a simple model to make, and once you have finished... just a sharp tap on the tail and the horse will flip for you!
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction. Your creases should look like this.
Using the creases you have made, bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
Fold upper layer's outside corners toward centre line, then fold the top downward along the crease shown. Unfold.
Cut only top layer up to the top crease.
Fold the legs upwards along the creases shown.
Fold these sections in half, toward the centre.
Turn model over and repeat steps 4-7 on other side. The model should now look like this.
Rotate model and make creases as shown. Unfold.
Inside Reverse Fold the head and the tail. Finished Horse!
Blunt the 4 feet of the horse by folding the tips upward on the inside of the model.
To make the horse do a somersault, sharply tap upwards under his tail.

Items.Title: Bird
Items.Subtitle: This beautiful traditional origami bird is actually quite easy to make, and if you fold the feet at just the right angle, it will stand up! For the best looking bird, you can use paper thats coloured on both sides: but white on the bird still looks nice if you dont have any double sided paper.
Items.Description: This beautiful traditional origami bird is actually quite easy to make, and if you fold the feet at just the right angle, it will stand up! For the best looking bird, you can use paper thats coloured on both sides: but white on the bird still looks nice if you dont have any double sided paper.

Steps.Tutorial: This beautiful traditional origami bird is actually quite easy to make, and if you fold the feet at just the right angle, it will stand up! For the best looking bird, you can use paper thats coloured on both sides: but white on the bird still looks nice if you dont have any double sided paper.
Start with your paper white side up. Fold in half, as shown.
Fold the outside corners into the centre line, and crease well.
Fold the top triangle backwards
Fold the corners of the model in toward the centre, crease well, then open again.
Bring the highlighted corner up and outward using the crease shown. Then bring the highlighted corner back down toward the centre line and flatten.
Repeat this step on the opposite corner... the model should now look like this.
Fold the outermost corners backwards on the angle shown and crease well.
Mountain fold the model in half. (Fold backwards).
Rotate the model slightly so you can see the bird forming.
Make these creases and unfold.
Using these creases, inside reverse fold to make the head and the tail of the bird.
Finished bird!

Items.Title: Flapping Bird
Items.Subtitle: This origami flapping bird is similar to the crane except for one important detail: it can flap its wings!
Items.Description: This origami flapping bird is similar to the crane except for one important detail: it can flap its wings!

Steps.Tutorial: This origami flapping bird is similar to the crane except for one important detail: it can flap its wings!
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold the top corner of the paper down to the bottom corner. Crease and open again. Then fold the paper in half sideways.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
Fold top triangular flaps into the centre and unfold.
Fold top of model downwards, crease well and unfold.
Open the uppermost flap of the model, bringing it upwards and pressing the sides of the model inwards at the same time. Flatten down, creasing well.
Turn model over and repeat Steps 4-6 on the other side.
Fold legs upward along the outside edges, then open again.
Use these creases to inside reverse fold these parts.
Inside reverse fold the head, and fold down the wings as shown. Then partially open them up again.
Finished flapping bird. To make the wings flap forward, pull the tail gently outwards. For more detail, check the video at the top of the page!

Items.Title: Twirling Bird
Items.Subtitle: The origami twirling bird is one of the easiest models to make, but its also so much fun! Try using different types of paper to see which one will twirl the best.
Items.Description: The origami twirling bird is one of the easiest models to make, but its also so much fun! Try using different types of paper to see which one will twirl the best.

Steps.Tutorial: The origami twirling bird is one of the easiest models to make, but its also so much fun! Try using different types of paper to see which one will twirl the best.
Start with your paper white side up. Fold in half, as shown.
Fold in half again, crease and open.
Now fold top of model down past the baseline of the model.
Fold whole model in half.
Rotate model so it is now standing up.
Fold down the top flap along the line shown. Then repeat the same thing on the flap behind.
Now fold the wings back upwards so they sit horizontally, as shown.
Twirling bird is complete! To make the Twirling Bird fly, throw it like a paper plane. It will tumble in circles!

Items.Title: Tortoise
Items.Subtitle: The origami tortoise is a great little model: its easy to make and it will stand there and look cute! You will need some scissors to make this model.
Items.Description: The origami tortoise is a great little model: its easy to make and it will stand there and look cute! You will need some scissors to make this model.

Steps.Tutorial: The origami tortoise is a great little model: its easy to make and it will stand there and look cute! You will need some scissors to make this model.
Start with your paper white side up. Fold in half, as shown, and open.
Now fold the top corner down to the bottom corner.
Fold the outside corners in to the centre line.
Fold these same triangles upwards to the top point.
Fold only the uppermost layers outwards as shown.
Cut ONLY the top layer up to the centre of the model.
Fold out the bottom flaps as you did in Step 5.
Fold the 2 sides in to the centrew, and the top point downwards as shown.
Now fold up.
Turn Over, your Tortoise is finished!

Items.Title: Puffy Bunny
Items.Subtitle: Aren't they gorgeous?! This lovely origami puffy bunny is bound to win hearts! Try with two-tone paper for a colourful effect.
Items.Description: Aren't they gorgeous?! This lovely origami puffy bunny is bound to win hearts! Try with two-tone paper for a colourful effect.

Steps.Tutorial: Aren't they gorgeous?! This lovely origami puffy bunny is bound to win hearts! Try with two-tone paper for a colourful effect.
Start with your paper white side up. Fold in half, then in half again, as shown. Crease well, then open out again.
Turn the paper over and fold in half diagonally and in both directions. Crease well and open out once again.
Holding the points shown, bring them both down to the centre point on the bottom line. Flatten model. This is called a waterbomb base.
Fold front triangles in to centre line.
Fold edges to centre line.
Fold front flaps of top triangles downwards, creasing well.
Fold again, diagonally, then tuck into pockets.
Turn over and fold bottom corners in to centre.
Fold front flap to the left.
Crease front flap into toward centre line.
Move top flap to the right.
Move the next flap to the right
Crease top flap in toward centre line.
Move top flap to the left.
Fold top layers outward along creases shown.
Open out the ears.
Fold nose under to form crease shown. Then fold back again.
To inflate bunny, blow into its nose!
Finished Puffy Bunny.

Title: Origami Toy
Subtitle: This wonderful collection of origami toys will have the kids (and adults) entertained for hours! So what do you do when there's no toys around? Make them! All you need is a piece of paper!
Description: Here we start with some very easy origami for kids, and build our way up to some slightly harder models for older kids, or children that need an extra challenge...

Items.Title: Monkey Mountain
Items.Subtitle: The origami monkey and the mountain toy is so much fun to play with! You cut the top off the mountain, and this becomes the monkey, then you place the monkey under the mountain, and it climbs all the way to the top...then falls off!
Items.Description: The fantastic origami horse is a favourite amongst anyone who has made it! It's a simple model to make, and once you have finished... just a sharp tap on the tail and the horse will flip for you!

Steps.Tutorial: The origami monkey and the mountain toy is so much fun to play with! You cut the top off the mountain, and this becomes the monkey, then you place the monkey under the mountain, and it climbs all the way to the top...then falls off!
Start with a square piece of paper, coloured side up. Fold in half in 2 directions.
Turn the paper over to the white side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
Cut the top of the model off: this is the monkey!
Fold uppermost flap upwards along the line shown. Repeat this step on the flap on the back of the model.
Now put the monkey in between the 2 bottom triangles.
The monkey is ready to climb the mountain! To get him to climb, move the bottom triangles up and down, keeping them together.
The monkey will climb all the way to the top if you keep shuffling the mountain... and then he pops out the top!

Items.Title: Fortune Teller
Items.Subtitle: Making the origami Fortune Teller toy is a great little activity for kids, because after they've made it... they can play with it!
Items.Description: This beautiful traditional origami bird is actually quite easy to make, and if you fold the feet at just the right angle, it will stand up! For the best looking bird, you can use paper thats coloured on both sides: but white on the bird still looks nice if you dont have any double sided paper.

Steps.Tutorial: Making the origami Fortune Teller toy is a great little activity for kids, because after they've made it... they can play with it!
Start with white side up. Fold diagonally in both directions.
Fold each corner into the centre point.
Turn over and again fold each corner into the centre point.
Fold in half along creases shown, both ways, and open.
Number each segment from 1-8.
Open up each flap and write a fortune in each segment. Below are some examples of fortunes you can write, but you can also make up your own.
Turn the model over and write a colour on each flap as shown.
Finished Fortune Teller. Use your fingers to open it up.

Items.Title: Samurai Hat
Items.Subtitle: The origami samurai hat is a great traditional model that is so simple to make, and wear!
Items.Description: This origami flapping bird is similar to the crane except for one important detail: it can flap its wings!

Steps.Tutorial: The origami samurai hat is a great traditional model that is so simple to make, and wear!
Start with paper white side up. Fold in half downwards.
Fold outer corners in to the centre.
Fold top layer only upwards in half.
Fold top layers outwards along creases shown.
Fold top layer only upwards along the crease shown.
Fold same top layer upwards gain.
Fold the bottom layer upwards to crease, and open again.
Tuck this layer into the inside of hat.
Finished Samurai Hat.

Title: Flower Origami
Subtitle: Some of the most beautiful origami models are the origami flowers... they look so stunning when made with either plain of pattered paper, and displayed in groups!
Description: Here we start with some very easy origami for kids, and build our way up to some slightly harder models for older kids, or children that need an extra challenge...

Items.Title: Blossom
Items.Subtitle: The origami blossom is a great model for both beginners and advanced origami lovers: as it is simple, yet can look so gorgeous: especially when put in large bunches of blossoms. Make them with tiny, thin pieces of paper of all different colours for a beautiful display.
Items.Description:
The origami talking dog is really easy, and kids love it!
You'll need a marker to draw on the eyes, nose and tongue, so have fun!

Steps.Tutorial: The origami blossom is a great model for both beginners and advanced origami lovers: as it is simple, yet can look so gorgeous: especially when put in large bunches of blossoms. Make them with tiny, thin pieces of paper of all different colours for a beautiful display.
Start with a square piece of paper, white side up. Fold in half and open. Then fold in half the other way.
Turn the paper over to the coloured side.Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. The model will fold along the creases. Flatten model
Rotate model so the open part is at the top.
Fold top layer of triangular flaps into the centre line.
Turn model over and repeat this step on the other side.
Fold the bottom corner upwards to the point shown. Crease very well and unfold.
Open out the front and back petals.As you open the front and back petals, the side petals should open up too, revealing the colour inside.
You can then fold the stem in half backwards to make the petals stay in place.
Finished blossom!

Items.Title: Flower
Items.Subtitle: This beautiful Origami flower is a favourite of mine. I learned this one at school, and made dozens of them for all my friends (and they loved them by the way!)
Items.Description: Make the origami ladybug out of red or yellow paper, and then draw some pretty spots on it afterwards.

Steps.Tutorial: This beautiful Origami flower is a favourite of mine. I learned this one at school, and made dozens of them for all my friends (and they loved them by the way!)
Start with a square piece of paper, white side up. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction.
Turn the paper over to the coloured side. Fold the paper in half, crease well and open, and then fold again in the other direction. Your creases should look like this.
Using the creases you have made, Bring the top 3 corners of the model down to the bottom corner. Flatten model.
Fold toward centre line and unfold.
Using the crease you have just made, open and flatten this flap.
Repeat step 4 and 5 on the other 3 flaps of the model.
Turn the page' of the front and back flaps; so your model looks like this.
Lift the top layer up, folding along the crease shown.
Now repeat step 8 on the remaining 3 flaps, so the model now looks like this.
Turn over and make sure there are equal pleats behind each side of model.
Pinch these two creases through all layers.
Now pinch the narrow end to make the edges meet behind the model.
Holding the narrow point of the model very loosely, pull the outermost petals toward each other until they meet.
Now form the petals by pinching the ends, and slightly folding back these tips. Finished Flower.
FLOWER

Items.Title: Lily
Items.Subtitle: The origami lily, also know as the iris, is a beautiful design. It takes a little longer than the other simple flowers, but stick with it, because the end result is worth it!
Items.Description:
The origami lucky star is so easy to make, but it looks so pretty... soon you'll be making hundreds!
You make it with a strip of paper. A good starting size is about 30cm, or 1 foot long, and about 1cm wide, or about half an inch.
Once you have made a couple, you can choose the length and width that you think makes the best star.

Steps.Tutorial: The origami lily, also know as the iris, is a beautiful design. It takes a little longer than the other simple flowers, but stick with it, because the end result is worth it!
Start with your paper coloured side up. Fold in half, then in half again, as shown. Crease well, then open out again.
Turn the paper over and fold in half diagonally and in both directions. Crease well and open out once again.
Holding the points shown, bring them both down to the centre point on the bottom line. Flatten model. This is called a waterbomb base.
Fold the top triangle into the centre and unfold. Using this crease, open out the triangle and flatten.
You'll need to repeat step 4 on all four of the flaps of the waterbomb base. The model will now look like this.
On the uppermost diamond, fold the outside corners into the centre line, crease well then open.
Fold the whole model in half and open.
Using the creases made in step 6 and 7, lift the bottom point of the model (the uppermost layer only) up to the top point, bringing in the sides of the model at the same time, as shown.
Repeat steps 6, 7 and 8 on each if the four sides. The model should now look like this.
Now fold down each of these triangles, on all four sides.
Rotate model upside down, so the open part is at the top.
Fold the outer flaps toward the centre and flatten.
Repeat step 12 on all four sides of the model. The model should now look like this.
Fold down all petals, opening the flower as you go.
Completed Lily!

Items.Title: Lotus
Items.Subtitle: The beautiful origami lotus is much simpler than it looks! Make it with some special textured paper for a lovely effect. It works best with paper that is a little flexible, as step 7 (see below) can sometimes make the paper rip if it is too brittle.
Items.Description:
The Origami Hat is a great model for kids to make, because it's so simple and fun to wear afterwards!
Use a large piece of paper, or newspaper for this design.

Steps.Tutorial: The beautiful origami lotus is much simpler than it looks! Make it with some special textured paper for a lovely effect. It works best with paper that is a little flexible, as step 7 (see below) can sometimes make the paper rip if it is too brittle.
Start with white side up. Fold diagonally both ways and open.
Fold each corner into the centre.
Fold each corner into the centre once again.
For a third time, fold each corner into the centre.
Turn model over and fold each corner into the centre.
Fold each corner inwards a small amount.
To form the petals, press down on the point shown, while slowly pulling the petal from behind, to the front. It's almost like turning the corner 'inside out'. Repeat on all corners.
The second set of petals are formed the same way, but the corner from the point shown.
he third set doesn't need to be turned 'inside out', just folded normally from below the first set.
Finished Lotus.

Items.Title: Flower Stem
Items.Subtitle: The Origami Flower Stem is a great little model, in that it allows any flower to stand up by itself, so you don't need a vase.
Items.Description: This beautiful origami pelican is simple and elegant, and it will stand up by itself. Use a small sheet of square paper to create this pretty design.

Steps.Tutorial: The Origami Flower Stem is a great little model, in that it allows any flower to stand up by itself, so you don't need a vase.
Start with a green square of paper, white side up. Fold in half, crease and open.
Start with a green square of paper, white side up. Fold in half, crease and open.
Start with a green square of paper, white side up. Fold in half, crease and open.
Start with a green square of paper, white side up. Fold in half, crease and open.
Start with a green square of paper, white side up. Fold in half, crease and open.
Start with a green square of paper, white side up. Fold in half, crease and open.
Start with a green square of paper, white side up. Fold in half, crease and open.

Finished Flower Stem. This model should stand on its own. The flower stem an be used for any origami flower which has a hole in the base, such as the tulip. Just insert the stem into the base of the flower.

Items.Title: Tulip Frog
Items.Subtitle: The origami tulip is a favourite model of mine: it is relatively simple and looks so sweet when bunched together with other tulips, or different types of flowers.
Items.Description: The Origami Jumping Frog is really easy to make... To make the frog jump to its best potential, use paper that's a bit thicker. You will need to use rectangular paper for this model

Steps.Tutorial: The origami tulip is a favourite model of mine: it is relatively simple and looks so sweet when bunched together with other tulips, or different types of flowers.
Start with your paper coloured side up. Fold in half, then in half again, as shown. Crease well, then open out again.
Start with your paper coloured side up. Fold in half, then in half again, as shown. Crease well, then open out again.
Holding the points shown, bring them both down to the centre point on the bottom line. Flatten model. This is called a waterbomb base.
Fold bottom corners of front flaps up to the top corner. Repeat this on the back as well.
Turn the front flap to the left, like turning the pages in a book. Do the same to the other side of the model.
Move the upper flaps toward each other, and tuck one into the other, as far as it goes.
When you flatten this, make sure the distances A & B shown are equal.
Repeat steps 6 & 7 on back of model, to get this.
Blow into base of tulip to inflate and shape the flower.
Peel each petal down, slowly and carefully. Your tulip is now finished. You can pair it with the flower stem as pictured.
